info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 14 at 8:27AM PDT until October 14 at 11:30AM PDT by NWS Hanford CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern.
* WHEN...Until 1130 AM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 827 AM PDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield and Oildale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM PDT THIS MORNING
